body:
## Expected Behavior

Worker role can successfully connect to an AWS Elasticsearch.

## Actual Behavior

Connections fail with the message:
```
error creating elastic search client: context deadline exceeded
```

I believe the reason for this error is that the elastic go client by default has sniffing / health check enabled which does not seem to work with AWS Elasticsearch. More details are here:

https://github.com/olivere/elastic/wiki/Using-with-AWS-Elasticsearch-Service

Perhaps the ability to enable/disable these features could be added to the config?

I haven't yet tried disabling sniffing and health check in the Temporal elasticsearch client yet, I'll report back here if it fixes the issue.

## Steps to Reproduce the Problem

  1. Try to enable advanced visibility using a AWS Elasticsearch persistence data store.

## Specifications

  - Version: v0.23.1

comments.body: This seems to be working now on temporal 1.6.3

title: Additional Elastic client config options needed to support AWS Elasticsearch
